Posts.Content: I was on Taxotere and Cytoxan too. Treatments were Fri. Sat I felt fine...Sun and Monday were days of just feeling like I had the flu....lots of sleeping...Sometimes got back to work on Tues, sometimes not until Wed. Each treatment for me gave me different side effects, but no nausea or vomiting.... Hope you feel better soon. Judy
Posts.Title: C&A

Posts.Content: Call your American Cancer Society. They set me up with an individual cancer survivor, as I didn't want to go to group sessions and they can also give you names of professional counselors if that's what you are looking for. Also, your local hospital's cancer center will have names for you. Judy
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Survivor Counselor

Posts.Content: Although I am extremely happy to report NED on my 3rd year mammogram, chest x-ray and blood work, I am now diagnosed as having osteoporosis. Dr. is quick to suggest IV infusion of Reclast or monthly Actonel pills. Since I have about every side effect that Femara can offer, I am of course reluctant to try these drugs and experience even more side effects. Anyone out there on these drugs ??? Judy
Posts.Title: Dancing with NED, except for having osteoporosis...

Posts.Content: I understand what you are saying. I had the same feelings after being told in 7/09 that I had breast cancer. I didn't know where to turn. Who to talk to...what to do. I expressed my dissatisfaction of being told over the phone I had bc and then nothing. They told me there used to be a person who counseled bc patients immediately after their diagnosis, but that person was let go due to cut backs in hospital personnel. Nice !! Finally, I found help in the surgeon's nurse who called me two days later. She was wonderful and has continued to help me through this. But they don't realize that a person needs help immediately after that dreadful diagnosis. Unfortunately, I didn't find this site until my chemo was over. I would definitely talk to your oncologist or surgeon and express your feelings about these things. You might also consider talking to your PCP or consulting a psychiatrist for some medication to help you through the anxiety of this diagnosis. I did and it helped me immensely. I don't know if you have to have chemo or just a lumpectomy/radiation....but it is all do-able and Im sure you will be fine. Judy
Posts.Title: Newly diagnoised with breast cancer

Posts.Content: I've been there.  Cried for weeks after my diagnosis and just couldn't deal with it.  I finally sought the help of a psychiatrist who put me on Lexapro.  Saved my sanity.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: When does the crying stop

Posts.Content: Sending lots of prayers and hugs your way. Judy
Posts.Title: Update on my reoccurence

Posts.Content: I've been there.  Cried for weeks after my diagnosis and just couldn't deal with it.  I finally sought the help of a psychiatrist who put me on Lexapro.  Saved my sanity.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: When does the crying stop

Posts.Content: I have been on Femara for 19 months and the side effects have not been too bad except for some weight gain. Because I fell into the Medicare "donut hole" I was forced to get my Femara from a mail order company in Missouri. Its the generic form of Femara. Since then I have been noticing even more weight gain and bouts of depression the day after I take the pill. Just wondered if anyone else noticed a difference between the generic form of medications and the "real thing". Thanks, Judy
Posts.Title: Femara vs generic brand

Posts.Content: Another July 3rd.... I got my diagnosis last year on July 2. This year's birthday has got to be better !!! Judy
Posts.Title: When is your Birthday?

Posts.Content: I have been taking Lexapro since about two weeks after my diagnosis last July and it has helped immensely and my tumor was estrogen +. Good luck. Judy
Posts.Title: antidepressants

Posts.Content: Another July 3rd.... I got my diagnosis last year on July 2. This year's birthday has got to be better !!! Judy
Posts.Title: When is your Birthday?

Posts.Content: Anyone ever experience constipation while undergoing radiation therapy? I'm only on day 8 of therapy. ..
Posts.Title: Rads question

Posts.Content: I'm on Femara for the last two months and have already gained 5 lbs, which doesn't help since I'm already overweight. Exercising on my bike every day but it doesn't seem to stop the scale from going up and up and up. So depressing. Judy
Posts.Title: am I destined to be fat while on tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: I always wear my wig at work. It just makes me feel better. Do what you feel most comfortable doing. Judy
Posts.Title: To wig or not to wig?

Posts.Content: I colored mine at the 5 month mark and instead of dark brown it came out dirty blonde, but at least its better than gray. Its growing so slow and I'm tired of the wig !!! Judy
Posts.Title: It's the Hair

Posts.Content: Anyone having excessing sweating from Femara? Even if I'm just doing some housework, the sweat is pouring off my forehead and my hair is all wet. Guess I should be happy I don't have bone pain (yet)... but its annoying and ruins your hairdo (with the little bit of hair I have left since Femara) !!!
Posts.Title: For those on the fence about tamoxifen and ER+....please read

Posts.Content: Oh, I love hearing things like this. Congratulations and may you and Nert have a wonderful time together. Judy
Posts.Title: Hands off, girls -- NED is all mine today!

Posts.Content: Oh me too. I go to bed at 11 but most nights its 2 or 3 before I fall asleep. Tylenol p.m. helps sometimes. Tried Unisom and it made me exhausted and groggy the whole next day. Going to try Benadryl too.
Posts.Title: Up all Night

Posts.Content: Unfortunately, I got my diagnosis the day before my birthday and when my daughter called to wish me a Happy Birthday, I had to tell her then. I told my son the same day too. There is no easy way to tell them. You just have to have a positive outlook and reassure them that you have good doctors and you are going to beat this. However, I did not tell other members of my family until after my first chemotherapy treatment. I had chemo first, then lumpectomy and radiation will start next week. Its very hard to admit you have bc..... I too had filled out my retirement papers and was going for some annual check ups when they discovered my breast cancer. So needless to say, retirement was postponed. You must go ahead with treatment. Its not easy, but you will make it through as all of us have. And yes, you will have to delay some things, but just tell yourself its only for awhile. My "angel" that helped me through all of this was my surgeon's nurse. I am sure you will find that "angel" to get you through your treatment. I always think of Barry Manilow's song....I Made It Through The Rain....with the others who got rained on too" Judy
Posts.Title: Just Had Sonogram and Scheduled to Talk With Surgeon
